website_summaries.verdict: With its numerous sharp blades, inexpensive price, and impressive warranty, it has a lot to offer, but also comes with a few flaws.
pros: Easy to adjust and versatile in the kitchen with 5 surgical stainless steel blades
cons: Flimsy plastic components that tend to bend when cutting large, dense vegetables

customer_reviews.title: “Thumb” Up!
customer_reviews.text: I give this product a thumb up. I decided to use it for the first time to make scallop potatoes. I stabbed the first potato with the guard and started going to town. The moment I was thinking to myself, “man this thing slices great!” is the moment the potato fumbled, and my thumb learned what it feels like to be a potato. $1700 ER bill later, my thumbs finger print is permanently altered. I had to rescan it for Touch ID. Dinner was eventually finished, and we’ve been using it ever since. Pretty sure this thing will cut meat easily too. Ask me how I know.
customer_reviews.author: RFloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: This mandolin is very similar to some of the more expensive ones, like the Cuisinart (which I also have) and the OXO. The v-blade seems to cut a little easier than the flat blades on other mandolins. The adjustable thickness is almost the same as the Cuisinart. Less expensive mandolins do not seem to have the option of several different thicknesses of slices. The legs are sturdy and the mandolin does not seem to move around a lot on the counter. I am looking forward to making some waffle fries with the ripple cutter and using it to grate cheese.
customer_reviews.author: J M White

customer_reviews.title: Mandoline Slicer that meets all your needs
customer_reviews.text: This mandoline slicer is easy to use with all the features you need. It comes with five slicers along with a storage box for all the blades. It has the straight blade for slicing and julienne. It has a grater and two size shredders. It is easy to clean as well. If you are looking for a good mandoline slicer for a good price this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Weber

customer_reviews.title: The best mandolin slicer!
customer_reviews.text: This Müller Austria V-Pro 5 Blade Mandolin Slicer is just amazing! It beats all the other slicer or whatever I had used before, it just does absolutely great job, every time. The Mandolin slicer is very good quality and sturdy, not any cheap plastic thingy. It also does slice soooooo thin (look at those carrot slice!), it becomes so much fun using it for cooking! I love my Mandolin slicer, and use it everyday since I bought it, get this one and you are not gonna regret!
customer_reviews.author: YTN

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The Mueller V-Pro 5 Blade Mandoline Slicer is wonderful! I don't know why I waited to get one. This is so much easier than slicing by hand. Adjustable thickness and the ability to julienne is added bonus. The slicer is very sturdy and the blade is razor sharp so slicing is effortless. The food pusher is hefty and large so I don't have to get my fingers anywhere near the blades, a feature I really like! The fold back guard on the julienne blade and the fact that everything comes apart for cleaning assures this will be a well-loved addition to my kitchen. Thanks, Mueller!
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it. I had the expensive French one a few years ago. It was heavy, big, tricky to use and dangerous. The blades were difficult to store. This Mueller mandoline is safe, easy to use, lightweight, etc. Works like a charm. The blades come a nice, compact storage box.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Russell

customer_reviews.title: Safety grip broke the first time using it!!
customer_reviews.text: The blade itself worked really well, but the safety holder that you insert the food into fell apart during my first use! I refuse to use this without it, because I've heard so many horror stories of people trying to just hold the vegetable or fruit with their bare hands and slicing whole chunks on their hands and fingers off. Definitely not safe!
customer_reviews.author: Jarom Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Really great value
customer_reviews.text: I've used the mandoline twice now and like it very much. The container for the blades makes storage so much easier. I'm able to store everything in a drawer very easily. I didn't have any problems with slippage when using. The julienne knob was smooth and easy and locked into place - I thought the design of this was very good, especially since it allows 2 different blade size options. Using the mandoline was very intuitive and I appreciated the pictures Mueller included with the instruction page. Can't speak to durability of the plastic parts since I've just used twice but the plastic seems a sturdy type.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good but very dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient machine. Sliced off the side of my finger when my hand slipped on the cheap holding (safety) device first time I used it. Don’t use unless you are wearing cut proof gloves. Other than that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I had consider purchasing a mandolin for a long time. After years of having to cut large vegetables to fit in the feed tube of my food processor, I started my search. I was impressed with the features of the Mueller for the price. Now that I have used it for 2 weeks, I am so pleased with my choice. The convenience of being able to slice, shred and grate foods without having to drag out my food processor makes me dread food prep less. Assembly, clean up, storage space needed for the Mueller Mandolin makes it as essential to my kitchen as my knives. Wish I hadn’t waited so long to make this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cecily Adwell

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slicer. The blades are super sharp (but be careful), there variety of blades are good. It's easy to clean and has a great warranty. The only thing I can think of to improve it a bit is the veggie holder/slider. Once the veggie gets down to certain height the holder does not push it through any longer. It tempts you to do it with you finger, but that is not a good idea. Overall, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: MOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, Frustrated. Useless for the most part
customer_reviews.text: First of all this it's a DANGEROUS tool. It's very likely that sooner or latter your fingers slide over the sharp blade, so use it with cut resistant gloves at all times. The grater blades are a joke. the blade size is so small that you find yourself moving the carrot 100 times per minute. "ridiculous". the tooth that are before the V blade are built so far away that doesn't work as well as my previous inexpensive mandolin that serve me for years.. I bought this item based on the reviews I read. my bad. I won't buy it again, and of course I won't recommended to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna Tuttolomondo

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but hard to slice apples. Feel its a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Blades are all EXTREMELY sharp. Easy to "put together". The knob/handle with 4 spikes sucks and is virtually useless. I purchased this item to slice apples to dehydrated. More trouble than it's worth to try to slice apples. Does not slice nicely. After coring the apple, apple will only get cut about 1/2 way, then you have to work it back and forth and finagle it the rest of the way. Not worth the money for what I purchased it for........which is to simply slice apples the same thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Meerman

customer_reviews.title: Product Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today and I was initially disappointed because there was no comprehensive instruction booklet just an inadequate instruction sheet. Planned to make coleslaw. Used the "large" shredder which made mush not shreds. The carrots stained the plastic. Could have done better with a box grater or food processor. Going to try a couple other things but more than likely I'll be returning it. Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Teagh

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, but not so practical.
customer_reviews.text: The blade itself is nice and very sharp. However, using the product is a bit tedious. The fruit/vegetable/cheese holder is too small to fit much inside without already having to cut it up. It takes a lot of pressure to hold anything that doesn't fit inside. This is due to the prongs not being long enough to actually keep things from sliding out. The julienne blades are a bit too far from the V-blade and usually gets the item stuck in between them.
customer_reviews.author: James Rosenogle

customer_reviews.title: I got it to use on sweet potatoes. It worked great the first few times ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fairly well. I got it to use on sweet potatoes. It worked great the first few times but now will barely cut through one. The blades dulled quickly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Slicing Wiz...LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so well made and of such quality, I'm totally impressed. It is incredibly well weighted for easy, non-skid use. The blades are super sharp, and it comes with a very nice case. I do wish there was some type of attachment for the "food holder" so it wasn't simply loose. In any event, I'm still working on a way to store it for easy access because I find myself using it a lot, and I've had it less than a week. It also is so easy to clean. I have already used it so many times in the few days I've had it. What a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Nita M.

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: If you want to do anything more than slice potatoes thinly, this mandoline doesn't work. The plastic platform that you slide the food item you're cutting over is capable of flexing a bit as it meets the blade. It's a problem if what you're slicing is harder than a potato. You have to apply pressure to get the blade to cut it, which causes the plastic platform to bend a bit. Then the food item enters the blade at an angle and gets stuck. The julienne blades aren't sharp enough or thin enough to be practical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again but works reasonably well.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a lot of waste when using the safety slider; too much flex in the device, works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Guns4all

customer_reviews.title: Fresh corn!!
customer_reviews.text: I love fresh corn in salads but I hate carving the kernels off the cob. I recently discovered that this mandoline can do the job in no time at all and does a better job that just my knife can. I use the slicer blade set for the depth of the kernels and, with one swipe, they're off. Four swipes and the cob is completely cleaned. I use this mandoline for other things, too, but the corn remover app just blew me away.
customer_reviews.author: LA Rider

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Where have mandolins been all my life? Well I was put-off by cheaper quality ones in the past. This thing does a fantastic job of slicing and chopping. For example, I used the larger french fry setup and then cross-cut the fries to make just perfect little cubes of potato for a soup. I know how to chop onions but this make them so convenient and consistent. Of course be careful with fingers around sharp things! And when you get down to the last 1/4 inch of onion (or what ever) finish cutting with your french knife. Oh, I also really like the ways this unit opens up for cleaning and folds pretty flat for storing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wood

customer_reviews.title: Well made with fingertip saving safety features
customer_reviews.text: Really well made product and nice safety features. These are usually one of the more intimidating pieces of kitchen gadgetry with open razor blades waiting for you to make a mistake.. to the extent this product minimizes the chance of losing the tip of a finger into the coleslaw, they've done a good job with the safety features with the holder fitting securely and a cover on the bottom for the julienne blades. The box for the unused blade inserts is nice so there's no reaching into a drawer and forgetting you have a loose blade in there. Solidly built, easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: This IS the mandoline slicer to purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: The Mueller V-Pro Multi Blade Adjustable Mandoline is beyond awesome. Slicing tomatoes was a breeze. (And having the same size slices really helps sandwiches from sliding apart). I was able to slice red onion super thin for pickled red onions. Comes with interchangeable blades so you can do a variety of different cuts. The blades are incredibly sharp!! And, the best part? The entire unit and blades can go in the top rack of your dishwasher. I waited a long time to purchase a mandoline slicer, did a lot of research... which led me to Mueller. This IS the mandoline slicer to purchase!! 5 star all the way!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Johns

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This slices well. Love the thickness adjustment. Use the supplied handle to cut your vegetables as my husband did not and sluced a cucumber size slice from palm of hand. His fault, not the slicers. Update Sept 27, 2020. I used the mandolin correctly and sliced off my fingernail and a chunk of skin underneath. This us going to the trash. Don't dare give it to anyone. Not worth the cost of 2 ER visits or pain and suffering. Vegetable holder slips out of place. Could this be a lawsuit? The least rating I could give it was a one star but it clearly doesn't deserve that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! This will cut you very badly!
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy. Cheap plastic overall. Inserts are difficult to switch out. Not safe whatsoever mainly. You will easily get bad injuries from this unit. Blades will cut your flesh. Two areas to get badly injured from. Slide blade and claw blade. Using provided tools and got very badly injured twice. We threw it in the garbage and still healing from cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Tom E

customer_reviews.title: NOT efficient!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this! When our previous grater/slicer broke we went with this one due to the great reviews. Boy are we disappointed. The julienne attachment is a permanent fixture housed underneath the cutting area so it gets dirty every time you use it regardless of which blade you’re using and then takes forever to dry. Also, the actually cutting area is so small that it takes a very long time (and a lot of energy!) to shred or slice. If we could return a used product, we would!
customer_reviews.author: HetyGrace

customer_reviews.title: Dull blades, poor holder, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: My Swissmar Borner V-1001 V-Slicer Plus finally got a bit dull from years of constant use. Gave it to a friend, then tried this one. Boy are the blades dull on this thing. The 'safety' food holder is tiny compared to the V-slicer and food just falls out. The vertical blades are so dull I can barely get them to cut an onion. I just can't understand the good reviews because this thing is a joke. Just ordered a new Swissmar Borner V-1001 V-Slicer Plus and am throwing this thing in the trash where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: By The Sea

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be Betty Crocker.
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you story of how I thought I was Betty freaking Crocker. I bought myself this vegetable slicer. I was SO excited to slice up my squashes and make a delicious dinner for my family. I got a little too happy with the slicer and added some thumb to the squash. Yep, I sliced off a chunk of my thumb because I’m an idiot. After gushing blood and screaming for my husband and passing out, my thumb is bandaged and the vegetable slicer is hidden away in a cabinet. I haven’t touched it since. So, yes it’s easy to use. Be careful. Don’t be an overachiever. Also, it was easy to clean the bloodied squash off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Tivnan

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy...!?
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed hunk of plastic. Does its intended job nicely with good ergonomics and seemingly durable construction. Adjustment knobs operate smoothly and the silicone feet keep the thing firmly grounded. Improvements? I’m not quite sure why they left a 1/4” of play between the main unit and side rails of the sliding safety holder? Seems to me like holding power and smoothness of operation would benefit from a tighter tolerance? Also, perhaps the julienne blades might be engineered to pop out for easier cleaning? Just saying...a positive purchase overall.👍
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: Follow up review after 3months of use
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review again being impressed with the customer service and the products quality of course. I have been using the slicer at least every other day esp for slicing onions. And it has been serving me great despite the heavy use. For almost everydays use I was needed a replacement of a blade. I am so impressed that after I contacted they reached me back within an hour and sent me a replacement. I have seen good customer service in USA but that prompt was one of very few. I would personally suggest my friends and relatives to buy this versatile tool.
customer_reviews.author: Naimur Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Sliced off the side of my finger
customer_reviews.text: The Vegitable guard was very clumsy to use. They kept falling off. I used it for a split second without the guard to finish slicing a sweet potato and sliced off the side of my pinky. Many weeks later it is still healing. Needless to say, I will not be using it again. I would like to return it (it was a gift from my daughter) but it might be too late. I can barely look at it without wincing with pain.
customer_reviews.author: lovescifi

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mueller VPro to thinly slice red onions, carrots, peppers, and other vegetables for salads and pickling. It works as expected (better than cheaper mandolines I've tried) and the interchangeable blades are useful but take a little force to pop out. Since they are sharp you should be careful. I like the intuitive knobs on the side and the "french fry slicer" feature. The box for the unused blades is really nice. As a vegetarian being able to quickly slice fresh veggies is very important to me, so I'm looking forward to really using it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I had debated whether to buy a stainless steel one or this one. This one has worked great, at half the price! I slice large quanities of fruits and vegetables to freeze dry. It slices as thin or as thick as I want it, in half the time. I havent figured out how to use the holder for grapes, strawberries or bananas yet. But I figure they are too small or soft. I do wear cut resistant gloves, though and so far, no cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Soarin

customer_reviews.title: dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago. For some reason I didn't try to use this till now, so it is too late to return. The thing used to hold the vegetable while slicing wouldn't hold the onion, it kept slipping which made the possibility of cutting myself very likely. I also couldn't exert enough force to slice the onion, which I read in another review. I suspect this is a problem with all mandolins unless your are slicing a soft fruit or vegetable
customer_reviews.author: Epepper

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My friend got tired of me borrowing her mandoline, so I just gave up and bought my own. Well-made, sharp, works beautifully, easy to clean - what more can you say? I rated it 5 stars across the board despite some people's concerns about cutting hazards. Sharp blades are SAFE blades - and anyone who runs their finger across anything sharp (like a razor blade) can expect to be cut - common sense, people. What a nice, convenient time-saver. I also have a large, professional mandoline with a straight blade that I will give away because I never used it after using my friend's Mueller Mandoline. This one is sooooo much easier to use and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Info Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use
customer_reviews.text: I heard horror story about mandolins but this one is very safe to use. It comes with a thing that you can hold down your veggies so that your hand will never come too close to the blade. We sliced beet and it came out beautifully. Haven’t tried the other blades yet. Everything came in pre- assembled. But there is no instructions on how to take them apart. However it’s not too difficult to figure it out. Very easy to clean. My 18 year old son was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: NTC

customer_reviews.title: Too many plastic intricate details to easily clean.
customer_reviews.text: PROS 1) Works safely as long as the users are using cut-resistant gloves 2) Shreds and has other types of blades, also one of the most popular sellers on Amazon.com CONS 1) Pain in the ass to clean, too many plastic intricate details to easily cleaning. 2) Blades cannot be sharpened. TIP It is extremely easy to wear non-latex gloves over the cut-resistant gloves nowadays!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Sucks!
customer_reviews.text: It's very unfortunate that I waited so long to use this past the return date. It really sucks. Not worth the money at all. First of all, I tried making sweet potato fries...the part that is supposed to grasp the vegetable didn't work at all. It wouldn't hold onto the potato at all. I even cut it in half to make it smaller. Second, the part that slices the vegetables must not be strong/sharp enough because my potato would not cut all the way through and everything kept just falling apart. I ended up using a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Almost but not quite
customer_reviews.text: Super good quality but very disappointed with the slice holder piece. We bought it to slice mangos and other fruit. The metal prongs don’t extend down past the flat surface of the holder so whatever you are trying to cut has to fit perfectly in the cut out holder in order to be held by the metal prongs. Additionally the guides that keep the holder off the blade are too high so you are left with a half inch piece of fruit you can’t slice. Wish we had kept the box so we could return it as I end up using a knife to cut the remainder of the fruit or vegetable anyway.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Best designed mandoline slicer, ever! (So far)
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best mandolin type slicer I've used to date. The easily adjusted and positioned blades are nice. And having an actual storage box for all those extra blades is a huge pluss, and for sure saves on the kitchen clutter I've often associated with having a mandoline slicer. I do wish their was a fully lowered position for the main slicer blade so as to completely remove the accidental cut risk. But this is buy far one of the safest designed slicers I've used and yeah I've taken a finger tip or two off with the blades so to see one this well thought out was relief when I needed to add one back to my kitchen recently.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the mandoline slicer very long, but had an issue with the protective cover underneath the unit as well as the storage box was bent and wouldn't close properly. I was prepared to return it when my husband dropped it and one leg snapped off. When Customer Service became aware of the problem, they immediately sent me a new slicer and followed up with me to make sure all was well. I have since made scalloped potatoes and they turned out great. I like that you can adjust the slicer width and get nice uniform slices. The blades are very sharp so extra caution is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joeykk

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: So I’ll start by saying i sent it back because i sliced the tip of my pinky off and now miss it. That being said it’s very sharp. Downside is that for potatoes it’s not sharp enough and hence why i had to push hard to slice the potatoes ending up slipping and in the er
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay

customer_reviews.title: I’m really happy with my slicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slicer. It’s super sharp and easy to use. I dropped it on to the tile floor before I even got to use it. Because it’s made of rigid plastic I thought I had probably broken it. A small piece broke off, but it didn’t impact anything important. The thing meant to grab hold of the food, so you don’t have to use your hand, is a bit clumsy and doesn’t always work well. Because the blade is so sharp, once I finally get the food onto the safety holder, it’s slices so fast that it hardly seems worth trying to use the safety holder. Super easy to clean. The storage box is really handy and safe.
customer_reviews.author: D Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome yet dangerous
customer_reviews.text: on the plus side, this thing is super sharp. It will slice your vegetables like a sharp Japanese knife. It is also somewhat easy to figure out - a few minutes with a potato, onion and parsnip will help you through the basics. On the down side, get the gloves. Even with the pusher tool, this thing will wavy cut and Julienne your finger tip in a split second. If you are scared about you or your loved one using it, don't get it. I think the simplicity and sharpness make it easy to lose your focus and get cut. And please don't operate while intoxicated.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepym

customer_reviews.title: Safety safety safety! Watch out as it is exceptionally sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Used to make sweet potato chips. Very difficult to make full rounded thin chips. The slicer moves in and out, but it catches and causes a small piece to break off. The sweet potato stained the plastic. I’ve tried a lot of cleaning and I know it is clean but looks ad. This is a very dangerous piece of equipment. Even with the cut resistant gloves, I ended up with one of the fingers on the glove was cut off, I’m glad it wasn’t me. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone who has children. You may have to go to the emergency room.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Urban

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the rave reviews are
customer_reviews.text: I can see the value in this thing because it is well-made for a cheap Made in China thing, but there is about a half inch gap between the blade and the slider. So you have to use your bare hand if you want to slice the last half inch of the veggies. And forget about using the julienne blades because after the first several slices, the top part of the veggies goes flying and you have to knife-chop it anyway. It is relatively well-made but not well-engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mandoline!
customer_reviews.text: I have also been thinking of getting a mandoline, and I decided to get this one. I needed one just to get thin slices on most vegetables, but I use this mostly for potatoes to make fries. The construction of the mandoline itself seems sturdy and I love the interchangeable slicers. With most fruits and vegetables, it works great, but with stuff that is more firm or harder, it gets a bit more difficult, like potatoes, but that was expected. My largest issue is that if you use the vertical slicer and the hand guard at the same time, I ended up slicing the hand guard and creating marks in the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, makes food prepping and cooking fuN!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mandolin, I researched a few models, looking at safety and durability. The order process was great, packaging and delivery great and the product works very well. It is so easy to slice and shred a variety of vegetables and cheeses. It’s important to be measured and NOT hurried because the blade is sharp so just pay attention. But it’s been fun to prepare my food using this mandolin. I’d recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Best Mandoline I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best designed, easiest to use mandolines I have ever owned. It is very easy to adjust, and the food holder is a must - the blade is very sharp!! How sharp? The picture is of a lotus root slice. Lotus root has the consistency of water chestnut, but with numerous holes! Slicing on an inferior mandoline will result in a crumbled mess of chunks underneath. The Mueller’s easy to adjust slice thickness sliced the root down to 1/8,” the best I’ve managed yet. The built in julienne blades are a great bonus, as is the blade holding box. I recommend this product highly!
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott Sears

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the relatively cheap price, however I am unhappy with it for several reasons: 1. It only slices cooked beets and cucumbers. Stuff that are soft and easy to slice. Potato, tomato, onions and anything else does not go through. 2. The grip that is supposed to hold the vegetables while slicing them doesn't fit on anything. It slides right off my potatoes and carrots. 3. I rinsed it right after using but it still stayed stained from the beets. 4. It doesn't come in a storage container so I keep it in the cardboard box it comes in, and it's not strong enough for repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for getting thin slices .  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this mandolin slicer. The blade is super sharp and can cut very thin slices (love how the onion rings come out and how it shreds cabbage). Honestly puts the cheese grater to shame. The different blade options are great and come with a storage box. I like how it folds up fairly compact for storage in small spaces. Safety warning, watch your fingers. It is easy to get carried away slicing and if you are not using the holder , fingers can come in contact with the blade. It is a fantastic product with a great many uses and comes recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works great but scary
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work reallt well until you get down to the last inch of whatever you are slicing, then it just becomes scary because the fruit/veggie is not entirely sliced. I would get a knife out to finish slicing then realized, if I have to do that, why get out the mandolin? Cleans very easily and not hard to figure out how to use it but it is the safety factor that made me return this one. One thing to note is that of all the products like this I have purchased, this one actually fits back into the box very nicely
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Safely slice your food with this quality Mandoline slicer.
customer_reviews.text: For a while now we have been looking for a mandoline slicer. Now that we have found this Müeller mandolin slicer, we can not believe why we haven't bought it sooner. This slicer is amazing! With safety in mind, this slicer has all the features you are looking for. It has a food holder, and a pusher. It slices, it grates, it shreds. Its suitable for all types of vegetables, it doesn't discriminate! Overall, quality is excellent, storage of blades is peace of mind, and above all safety features is why we bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Richie Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super-versatile, well-designed, solidly-constructed, and great-value kitchen tool! The only "criticism" I can think of, if there is one, is that with all the grooves, nooks, and crannies it isn't the simplest tool to clean by hand. But even with that, it's a very minor observation. It's sharp...real sharp...so cleaning must be done with care...but it's a mandoline so what else would one expect?!? I own other Mueller devices and I like them all. Good, solid products and good, solid values. This mandoline is easy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jadd Miller

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: The mandolin system is awesome, but don't cut off your middle finger, including 1⁄2 your nail....which is what I did. Know where all you digits are before you start going back and forth in that smooth motion to cut whatever it is into thin slices. It's an awesome tool, but do not allow anyone under 21 to use it without you supervision! I brought it out for 3 kids trying to make salads (all between 12-19) and everyone was going for bandaids. Lucky it was only the knuckles.....but later I took off most of my middle finger before first knuckle...ended up in emergency room...
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Page

customer_reviews.title: Way too complicated to use
customer_reviews.text: Super excited about this slicer after reading the reviews. However you know when something has too many features that it’s too complicated to use - this is it. I couldn’t get my vegetables to stay stationery with the roll plastic feature. It kept sliding out. I then watched the video how to operate it and almost sliced my finger. I couldn’t figure out how to open the bottom section with the julienne blades to clean. The whole thing was way more difficult to operate than my cheap Mandoline slicer. Returning it
customer_reviews.author: angc

customer_reviews.title: Indespensible kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mandolin for several years now. I use it constantly and it's held up perfectly. Such an easy and fast alternative to using and cleaning a food processor, and more consistent slices than manually slicing with a knife. Great for making potato chips, and the jullienne cutters make perfectly sized fries. None of these devices are perfectly safe. Even the supplied cutter guards aren't fool proof. I ALWAYS wear a Kevlar glove on my slicing hand, it's saved me more than a few times. It's a highly recommended accessory, and a lot cheaper than a trip to the ER.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kilcoyne

customer_reviews.title: High quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this item! The quality of construction is great. 1. Retractable feet for using stand alone or in container. 2. Julienne feature and with two widths. Olas a protective cover to protect from cuts and open to clean. 3. Different level thickness adjustment. What more could you ask for in this product. 4. Different blades! All you need. 5. A blade storage box. That is sturdy to protect all blades. This is quality safety. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Keh

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL MANDOLIN
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful- it comes with multiple slicing blades for various cuts, a julienne blade that you can rise up, and is built very sturdy (hey, it's from Austria, no surprise there! It's a vast improvement over my previous mandolin,  , which had only 1 blade, no julienne blade, a very limited thickness range of about 1mm to 3mm, no fold-down stand, and was built very shoddy. There's just no comparison!
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slices every time.
customer_reviews.text: I have fought to get the perfect thickness for my onion and tomato slices for my burgers and sandwiches. Everybody seems to slice them too thick. Whereas I like to put several thin slices to get maximum coverage. My wife thought I was crazy. Maybe I am ,but finally I get it the way I want. She’s changed her tune after seeing how well I can slice these veggies to the perfect slice. I love this mandolin and will be doing more cookouts with perfectly sliced veggies for all. My wife loved the cheese grater for her nachos.
customer_reviews.author: Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Makes them tasty wavy fries!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. It works well and is easy to clean. It is not as fancy as some of the others but does what it is supposed to do without any issues. I would recommend to anybody who needs a little help in the cutting veggies dept.
customer_reviews.author: john presley

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, Sharp, and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Having used all of the attachments, I can confirm that they are all durable, sharp and easy to use. I hardly ever use my box grater or chef's knife anymore. This mandoline slicer/grater does it all. For safety, I only gave this 3 out of 5 stars because the slicer attachment does not come with any kind protection against slicing open a finger. If the manufacturer reads this, please devise some kind of cover that you can slip over the blade so that the attachment can be handled without fear of finger injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer in New England

customer_reviews.title: Where have you Mandoline all my life
customer_reviews.text: Well, I tried my mandoline today for the first time, and it was very easy to use and clean up. I typically slice everything by hand, but now that I have trigger thumb in both hands, it is not always easy to do. So today i grabbed my large zucchini and my mandoline so I could make myself some chips. Not only was able to slice the zucchini paper thin, my thumbs/hands didn't hurt. I don't know how I went this long without having a mandoline, but now that I have, I will be trying other things. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting to buy a mandolin for a really long time, I wanted to get a decent one, not professional grade, but not a rinkidink one either. After a lot of research, I got this Mueller V Blade. First try I used the V blade, the cuts were really sharp and consistent. Easy to clean, the cuke just just washed off the blade immediately. I also tried the wavy cut just for fun, also worked really well. I didn’t use the safety feature till I got close to the end, and it felt really safe, yet I didn’t waste any of the cuke.
customer_reviews.author: Hat

customer_reviews.title: My New Kitchen Friend
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love ... I love that I can adjust the thickness of the slices that I am making. In some cases I want thicker slices and in some cases I want thinner and this gives me that flexibility. The safety grip seems a little clunky but it is workable. This has made my job of making fresh cream corn a whole lot easier when I am cutting 2 dozen ears of corn at a time and only want to skim off the tops of the kernels. I am impressed and very happy with this mandoline. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does more than I realized!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mandolin. About 6 months ago I became vegan and am preparing a lot more vegetables in many different ways. I also have a food processor, but honestly this mandolin does pretty much everything except chop! Plus its smaller, easy to store, dishwasher safe, and straight forward to use. Because of all the "sharps" I gave it 4 stars for safety but not sure how to make it safer. It is definitely worth the price and in considering getting one for my daughters this Christmas. Indispensable kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Sliver or slice?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time in original packaging w/o any damage. All parts accounted for. Immediate telephone support for question about cleaning julienne portion. This item may be of Austrian design but mfg'd in PRC (China). Misleading advertising. Nevertheless appears to be of good quality and sturdy for intended purpose. Purchased safely gloves for my spouse and myself as suggested by the reviews. Think surgical instrument sharpness. Will put it through its paces now that I'm equipped with "protection" and the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Pablito

customer_reviews.title: A SLICE ABOVE OTHERS
customer_reviews.text: I AM THRILLED WITH MY MANDOLIN. WHEN I FIRST RECEIVED IT, I FOUND IT DIFFICULT TO REMOVE THE BLADE THAT WAS IN THE MANDOLIN AT THAT TIME. I CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE AND SPOKE WITH JOHN PALMER WHO WAS EXTREMELY HELPFUL, COURTEOUS AND KNOWLEDGEABLE. HE NOTED THAT IT IS BECAUSE OF ITS NEWNESS AND ADVISED ME TO LEVEL THE BASE AND TO PRY IT UP. IT WORKED! I EASILY CHANGED BLADES WITHOUT FURTHER PROBLEMS. I USED IT TO SHRED ZUCCHINI, SLICED CUCUMBERS AND EGGPLANTS. IT WAS EASY TO CLEAN AND I SEARCH RECIPES WITHOUT CONCERN FOR CUTTING AND SLICING. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Franchini

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality blade and useless item to take up space
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, had to basically force the apples into the space under the blade due to its initial dull edge. I ended up ultimately cutting nearly the tip of my thumb off after a pice of cucumber getting jammed and taking off the glove because of its interference with being able to troubleshoot. I would highly discourage you to buy this. I tried to return it and was 5 days outside of my “return window” so that was a fun 30.00 gone to waste. Additionally to the things mentioned above this thing is nothing short of a nightmare to clean and takes about three times the room to store than my previous slicer.
customer_reviews.author: jayne van dorsten

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The blades snap in and out fairly easily, and they're very easy to clean off. The slicer works very well on vegetables, apples, meat and hard cheeses, and it works okay on semi-hard cheeses like cheddar. I like it better than my handheld grater for grating parmesan, although it's very easy to grate too much. I haven't used the julienne blades yet, but I do open their cover on the bottom after rinsing to make sure they dry. The plastic container for the blades is handy. I use this often enough already that it's been worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Lauri Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Slices onions, carrots, peppers, potatoes, fingers
customer_reviews.text: This is a good gadget. So far it’s sliced or julienned every kind of veggie that has crossed its path. It’s also very easy to thoroughly clean. Its biggest safety feature is that it will totally **** up your fingers if you so much as think about touching the blades - you do it once and you’ll treat it with respect from then on (some of us learn better from an object lesson than from common sense). Easy to end up like The Black Knight if you disengage your brain during use, but that’s what makes it a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Buys Too Much Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Works great with maybe one additional feature that should be added
customer_reviews.text: My previous mandolin broke, so had to get another one. This one is great, and comes with many attachments for any type of slicing. The blade is VERY sharp, so be careful when using it. The one feature that it doesn't have, compared to my previous one, is a thickness guide. So when I want to slice something 1/4" (for example), I can adjust the thickness, but it's not labeled for the thickness. I can visually estimate or take a ruler, but I feel they should have put the measurements on the dial that adjusts thickness. Other than that, go for it... great product..
customer_reviews.author: Elvin Frost

customer_reviews.title: Cutting Guard Is Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: The cutting guard it’s not so easy to use. It just leaves a big chunk of what you’re cutting leftover. If you’re cutting something lengthy like a carrot or cucumber it is easier to just hold it and cut it. The blade that it comes with the V-shaped blade is pretty sharp. I found the two dials that change the thickness of the vegetable you’re cutting to feel a bit flimsy. The images which show the thickness or shape change to switch to are difficult to read. I have not tried the other blades yet.
customer_reviews.author: Images from Oz

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the previous mandolin slicer that I had to get rid of because of the lack of safety features that resulted in me losing a good piece of my finger this slicer has all the safety features, I need to be sure that doesn't happen again. It is also much easier to use with several different cutting blades that have allowed me to slice cucumbers for pickles and numerous other vegetables for everything from salads to stews or appetizers. I would highly recommend this slicer for anyone looking for a time-saving prep tool
customer_reviews.author: Rockie47

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Mueller line is top of the line.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Another home run from Mueller. If this company’s name is on a product it should be your first choice. Quality engineered, excellent service and support. I hesitantly bought a Mueller instant pot long ago and Amazon botched the order. Mueller customer service stepped right up and I got my product. When I used it I was so impressed that each time I need a kitchen gadget I look for Mueller. Never disappointed. Support these guys, this is a great company.
customer_reviews.author: David Plokhooy

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality, well-engineered, plastic-based mandoline. It is not flimsy, and it has a nice plastic box for storing the accessory blades. I haven't had it long enough or used it for enough different tasks to give definitive comments on its long term durability or versatility. It is easy to adjust the slicing thickness with a control knob; a separate knob controls the julienne blades. The device could be improved by having an visual indicator by the knobs that would display the currently-set thickness of cut.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler R Law

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the mandolin slicer! I’m a huge canner and this has made my life so much easier. It’s slices onions, peppers, cucumbers and apples so nicely! I love shredding carrots with the shredder also! I’m also a big salad eater and this is such a time saver for that also. I use this almost every day and can’t say enough about how much I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennier630

customer_reviews.title: Finally the perfect mandoline
customer_reviews.text: This mandoline is easy to clean, simple to operate and has features I haven't had on the others I've tried. My kitchen is tiny and I only have room for the most efficient tools and this one's a keeper. Works well on thin slicing tender pears and I can make perfect french fries in a jiffy. No more hours grating carrots and cheeses. (No grated knuckles!) This is one of those rare products that was worth far more than I paid for it. Well done Mueller product development department. I love your mandoline!
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I usually use my Cuisinart for slicing/grating veg, hard cheese, semi-frozen meats etc. This mandoline is much easier to take out and use. Also easier to clean. In this time of shut-down, I cook almost everything myself (no restaurants, and my low-sodium diet does not correspond with most carry-out door). My latest addiction is a very simple condiment of thinly sliced red onion macerated in vinegar, cider vinegar if you have it. Doesn’t take long, great for salads, burgers, what have you. This mandoline does a perfect job with it. Just watch your fingers. It’s a sharp sucker.
customer_reviews.author: D Olin

customer_reviews.title: Delivers quality, durability and efficiency in one compact unit.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: First use was for slicing zucchini squash lengthwise. The Müeller Austria Premium Mandoline worked like a charm with it’s super sharp blade and adjustable thickness for slicing. The product comes with a variety of five blades for slicing and dicing to your hearts content. Easy to rinse off. Stores beautifully back into it’s original box. Four of the five blades store safely into their custom made container to prevent accidental nicking of fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Carole L. Sustak

customer_reviews.title: Extremely dull blades.
customer_reviews.text: Mangled my cucumbers that were right off the vine. Nice and crisp but still had to be forced across the blades and now I will be canning ugly pickles. Lol. There are worse things though... like paying for dull blades that really didn't do a thing for saving time in the kitchen. The seller was fine though - it came in a timely manner and the packaging was nice. I just think my blades must have somehow bypassed the sharpening station prior to being packaged and shipped. If not, then I just don't know how this thing got so many good reviews because it's not worth the money for dull blades.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Every Kitchen Should Have
customer_reviews.text: *Edit: After a quick reply from the Customer Service department, I've changed my original 4 Star Review to 5 Stars! The only dislike I have is the cleaning. I've only used it once so as I continue to use it I will develop shortcuts. I'm sure if I were not such a stickler for cleaning things, this will have gotten 5 Stars all around. Oh, and the blade removal could be a bit easier but a small screwdriver and viola! Other than that I'm impressed and glad I made the investment. - Steve D.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money and I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and the box in perfect condition. We have only used it once to slice apples for a pie. I really liked the ability to adjust the thickness of the slices. I'm looking forward using it to prep other dishes. Cleanup was fast and easy, also safe to use if you read the instructions and follow the directions. This in not a flimsy product and worth the price I have owned one that cost 5 times more and was not better.
customer_reviews.author: Larry and Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely-designed slicer, easy to use and built to last for years of kitchen use. Of course, it has an exposed, very sharp blade and that's a bit unforgiving of careless use. Please order a set of safety gloves, and be careful. Then again, if one cannot use this slicer safely, then one should also never risk handling sharp knives, open-face graters, or vegetable peelers. But, just like a quality chef's knife, this slicer is an easy cutter in a sturdy, stable device. That is a safety factor all in itself.
customer_reviews.author: Graybyrd

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to cut even cucumbers. Slices so thin you see thru them even IF you can getr a slice. I got it to slice cukes, onions, tomatoes, potatoes....no slicing to all of these. Must push plates from underneath to get dislodged for cleaning. I can use a knife and not go through the cleaning of this item in less time and effort. Definitely not my thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mandoline at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I am not a big kitchen gadget person but after going to a week long cooking school I realized how much easier this would make my life. It is as good as mandolines that cost $100 or $200. The main difference is that the more expensive ones are all metal but I find this just as easy to use as the metal ones and for my purposes, this works great! I like the 8 different widths and the julienne options. I can’t believe I waited this long to get one of these!
customer_reviews.author: suger booger

customer_reviews.title: Sharp - Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I recommend purchasing this mandolin along with a pair of steel mesh gloves, because the attachment meant to protect the user from the blade is very clumsy and did not do a good job securing larger/oddly shaped foods (like sweet potatoes). As the title says, the blade is very sharp and does a great job at cutting whatever it is you need cut. It is also good at cutting finger tips off and sending you to the hospital if you are not careful. I will be using this mandolin again once my finger recovers, but only with a steel mesh gloves. Please don't make the same mistake as I did, and cut without hand protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp. Works Well So Far.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, but it's taking a while for me to get used to. I sliced many gallons of cucumbers this summer and it worked well. Cleaning is a little tricky since food gets stuck in the grooves, so be prepared to used a brush or something that will get in there without exposing your fingers to clean it. BUY SOME SAFETY GLOVES!!! The blades are very sharp. Don't even try to use these types of products without a good glove made for this type of work. I'd recommend this tool to friends...and tell them to buy the gloves at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Lori E

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Versatile and Easy to use Slicer!
customer_reviews.text: Mueller Austria Premium Quality V-Pro Multi Blade Adjustable Mandoline Cheese/Vegetable Slicer, Cutter, Shredder with Precise Maximum Adjustability. This is a well built easy to use adjustable slicer with blades and options for wavey cuts, adjustable slicer for thick or thin slices or fine and coarse shredding. Also Provide julienne slicing, safety food holder and a Juicer holder. Blades are sharp so buy some PPE to protect yourself.
customer_reviews.author: George Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: You get great results
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the Adjustable Madoline Slicer and could not be happier with it. Simple to setup, simple to use. The results of slicing fresh cucumbers to pickle was amazing. In the amount of time it would have taken to begin to find a knife, I had an entire bowl of perfectly sliced cucumber chips ready for the canning jar. I am not a cook. I putter. With this slicer, I feel like a pro in the kitchen. It is a great machine that I would highly recommend to anyone who cooks. I will probably buy others to give as gifts. It is that good.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: A very happy customer! Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a mandoline for years, but only in the last few weeks sheltering at home did I decide to simply make up my mind and buy one. This mandoline has all of the features I wanted, especially fully adjustable slicing thicknesses and clean lines. I had no idea it could also be easy to set up and use and be so easy to wash. It even includes a storage box for the blades/graters, which is perfect. I diced onions for my marinara this morning: wow. The dice is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ros

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Blades!
customer_reviews.text: I love how sharp the blades are and how I can adjust the thickness of whatever I'm slicing. It was pretty simple to figure out and that's being with never using a mandolin slicer before. I will never go back to using a knife again for slicing veggies. The price on this was a few dollars more than other mandolin slicers but they seemed flimsy looking. So glad I've paid a little extra and received something that not only works great but will last.
customer_reviews.author: dorothy sherratt

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use slicer
customer_reviews.text: A great slicer for quick slicing in the kitchen. Always heed all safety directions with these, as I have had some mishaps with other slicers i dont want to elaborate on. This one works great for fast slicing, although it takes some getting used to to get the hang of it at first. Once you've read all the directions, you'll find it's easy enough to use, clean, and the variety of slicing is a bonus. The blades snap off easily, and are interchangeable. Small and convenient enough to quickly use, slice, clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlove

customer_reviews.title: After using Borner V-Slicer for nearly three decades, we ...
customer_reviews.text: After using Borner V-Slicer for nearly three decades, we decided to replace it with Mueller. It is well designed, with multiple blades and has been a pleasure to use. In particular, the adjustable slice depth, and built in cross cut features are vast improvement over our previous slicer. The blades are very sharp (and one needs to exercise caution). The food holder is designed well, again, a vast improvement on the Borner design, and should protect one’s fingers. The accessories are well packed in a plastic container. I look forward to using this for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Suma Mudan

customer_reviews.title: Tries to do too many things
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this product like a standard mandoline. I works pretty well in that capacity. I have not tried all of its features, but I recommend you stay with your box shredder instead of using this device for that purpose. I find that it flexes a lot when you use it, although that may not be a problem. If I use some of its other features I may change my mind about this device. Time will tell, .
customer_reviews.author: Morning Edition Listener

customer_reviews.title: This is the Vegetarian/Vegan's BFF for REAL.
customer_reviews.text: As a new and determined Vegan adventurer, this makes my life SO much easier. I have owned equipment like this before, but this is a much better product in terms of craftsmanship and ease of use. The stand that props it up diagonally as I work means I can go to town without lifting and removing the veggies at intervals. The blades make quick work of any veggie I throw at them and cleanup is a breeze. I feel like I want to buy an extra one to have on hand in the event they no longer make this or change it. I have product dependency issues and might just buy a second anyway :)
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingGrlOH

customer_reviews.title: Caution
customer_reviews.text: This product is dangerous to use. My husband cut his finger and resulted in a trip to urgent care. The doctor said that they have had 3 recent injuries come to this clinic alone for similar injuries. The doctor said that if his injury had been any worse wound care would have been necessary. My husband has experience as a butcher. He is very familiar with sharp knives. We threw this device in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I can see why this has such high ratings,,,does what it says and is well made and engineered. The hand protector is really clever. The gripper 'needles' retract as it slices down towards the end of the vegetable and I wouldn't slice w/o it for safety reasons. The rubber pads on the bottom did a nice job of keeping the mandolin from moving. Comes apart really easy for cleaning. Easy to adjust the thickness of your slices.
customer_reviews.author: John Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mandolin
customer_reviews.text: This mandolin is awesome. The blades are super sharp, so be careful! I did find that the safety slicer did not hold my vegetables very well, they kept slipping off, so ended up slicing my thumb! I bought a glove made specifically for use with a mandolin....highly recommended! The blades come in a storage container which makes it easy to store on the shelf with the mandolin. The adjustment knob is a great feature and allows you to select any slice size you want. To remove or change the blade, I turn the mandolin over and press the blade at the bottom, easily pops out. I recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: so far it seems to be great
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a couple times but so far it seems to be great. I've sliced cucumbers for dehydrating and I am able to cut them really thin so they dehydrate well. I bought some of those no cry gloves to use with it and so I think it will be quite safe as long as I use common sense in using it. I haven't used the push thing with it yet so I can't comment on that. Bus so far I am quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sellers
